entry.title: Movie: The Wolverine, starring Hugh Jackman (2013) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: The Wolverine, starring Hugh Jackman (2013) (2)20160307
I enjoyed this one a lot. We needed subtitles when we watched it
though, so we missed a lot of the subtlety in the Japanese
dialogue. It was fun to watch on our way home from being in
Japan. I really liked the moments of dialogue though, especially
when Mariko is talking about how her grandfather would tell her
stories about Wolverine. There were a lot funny bits, like when he
throws the finance minister out the window. And there are some
really gross moments that make me cringe even now, i.e. the scene
were he cuts his chest open. Again, Wolverine kills everyone. I
think the strongest thing about this movie is that it really is a
"Wolverine" movie, as there are basically no other mutants of
importance.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: X-Men: First Class, directed by Matthew Vaughn (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: X-Men: First Class, directed by Matthew Vaughn (2011)20160307
It's cool that this movie opens with the same footage from the
earlier movie. It's very neat and I love that they merge the
"revenge quest" with the international action. It does an awesome
job setting up the story and relationships that permeate the rest
of the series. It's kind of absurd how much the movie is about
"boobs and babes" though. The captions on place locations are
really on the nose, "Secret CIA Research Base" and "Russian
Military Leader's Mansion". Finally, I found the Banshee and Fly to
be really lame characters and Havoc's initial way he uses his
powers to be pretty meh.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Movie: X-Men Origins: Wolverine, starring Hugh Jackman (2009)
entry.content:
Movie: X-Men Origins: Wolverine, starring Hugh Jackman (2009)20160307
The opening of this movie is so awesome. There are a lot of weird
things in it though that don't make a lot of sense to me. For
instance, it's not explained how he gets the name "Logan". I like
the cameos and references to the other movies, such as Stryker
talking about his son. Deadpool is great until he inexplicably has
no mouth. It's neat that Cyclops shows up, although it doesn't make
sense that he can't see. This movie has a really bad reputation,
but it really isn't that bad.
  • Movies
  • 2009

entry.title: Movie: X-Men: The Last Stand, directed by Brett Ratner (2006)
entry.content:
Movie: X-Men: The Last Stand, directed by Brett Ratner (2006)20160307
It's interesting that this movie has such a bad reputation, because
it works really well compared to the last one. Mystique is one of
the strongest and most interesting characters in it, and Jean is
pretty amazing too. It's very lame that Magneto just ignores
Mystique, which seems very uncharacteristic given their long
interaction together.
  • Movies
  • 2006

entry.title: Movie: X2, directed by Bryan Singer (2003)
entry.content:
Movie: X2, directed by Bryan Singer (2003)20160307
This was a much stronger movie than the previous and works a lot
better today. I thought that the number of cameos was really
great. I don't like that there's no explanation for why Magneto's
team is different. It's insane how many people Wolverine kills.
  • Movies
  • 2003

entry.title: Movie: X-Men, directed by Bryan Singer (2000)
entry.content:
Movie: X-Men, directed by Bryan Singer (2000)20160307
We did an X-Men movie marathon on a plane trip. It was interesting
to watch such an old movie. I think the best part is Rogue. A lot
of the fights and jokes are really bad. Cyclops' stuff on his head
is way to big and ugly. It's interesting how dominate Wolverine is
in the whole series.
  • Movies
  • 2000

entry.title: Movie: The Hundred-Foot Journey, starring Manish Dayal (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: The Hundred-Foot Journey, starring Manish Dayal (2014)20160306
My wife tells me the movie is quite different from the book, but I
definitely enjoyed it. I thought the last act was a bit undeveloped
as there wasn't enough dialogue to understand what he was going
through. I wish there was more with Marguerite as well.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Bridge of Spies, starring Tom Hanks (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Bridge of Spies, starring Tom Hanks (2015)20160305
This was a nice movie that was pretty inspiring for Donovan's moral
fortitude. It's a bit like "To Kill a Mockingbird" but with the
whole spy/cold war thing going on at the same time. I wish they
went into a bit more about what the spy did and how they knew about
him.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Crazy, Stupid, Love., starring Steve Carell (2011) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Crazy, Stupid, Love., starring Steve Carell (2011) (2)20160304
We watched this movie again and really loved it the second time as
well. There's so many cute and clever moments in the movie. The
morals of the movie are a little bad though, because there's no
resolution to some of the bad behavior of the characters. For
instance, the wife does not really suffer because of her adultery;
the husband does not really resolve the issue with the teacher;
Jacob does not really have any consequence for his previous
behavior; and Jess' decision at the end to give the kid the photos
doesn't make any sense, especially because she has them with her
even though she couldn't have predicted his speech at the
graduation. Nevertheless, if you don't think too hard, hte movie is
very clever and fun.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Movie: The Importance of Being Earnest, starring Colin Firth (2002)
entry.content:
Movie: The Importance of Being Earnest, starring Colin Firth (2002)20160302
This is such a silly, funny movie. It's amazing how many of the
famous Oscar Wilde quips come from it.
  • Movies
  • 2002

entry.title: Movie: The Man from U.N.C.L.E., starring Henry Cavill (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: The Man from U.N.C.L.E., starring Henry Cavill (2015)20160301
This was a really cool and flashy movie. I loved the way it was
shot and the structure of most of the individual scenes. The ending
was very exciting. I don't think it could really be made into a
series, because the reason it is so strong is that it the initial
interaction of the two spies is so interesting, but I worry that
the production team was trying to set that up in the ending.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Vampire Academy, starring Zoey Deutch (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Vampire Academy, starring Zoey Deutch (2014)20160226
Going into this movie, I assumed it would be extremely lame and
cliche, like a live action version of the Monster High cartoon. The
movie started off in a really weird way with a lot of action and
proper nouns that made me think it was going to be a sort of
teenage Underworld, but it transformed rapidly into something very
different. After that moment, I thought it would be more like a
cross between Twilight and Harry Potter, but it barely used those
tropes as well. I felt like it was much more like an arc of a
season of Buffy... lots of cute quips and dialog in a really weird
world that is super inspired by pop culture. I really liked it and
feel it might be a personal classic for me. I think I may try to
read the books too, as I got the impression that so much was
compressed for time.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials, starring Dylan O'Brien (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials, starring Dylan O'Brien (2015)20160226
This movie is way different than the first one: much scarier,
darker, and trying to do a lot more. There were many moments in the
whole story that remind me of Greek mythology. In particular,
there's a long sequence here that reminds me of the Island of the
Lotus-Eaters from the Odyssey. The world is very interesting here
as it mixes together many standard themes from zombie stories and
other tropes of young adult fiction into a new mix. It's strange
how close humans live to the monsters without seemingly any
consequence when they reach the city in the North. I'm surprised in
general about how populated the world is. I found the ending to be
a bit repetitive and I was annoyed that the characters ended
roughly where they began in terms of their goals (although, they've
definitely changed (and earned that change) along the way.)
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Lazer Team, starring Burnie Burns (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Lazer Team, starring Burnie Burns (2015)20160226
This movie was extremely silly and had a lot of lame jokes and a
lot of clever jokes. Some favorite moments... when Adam says he's
familiar with incompetence, being raised by the military; when they
talk about how everyone always shoots a nuke, but it didn't work in
Independence Day; and when the girl asks about the best place to
get donuts and they cops go into a long answer. Funny.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Million Dollar Arm, starring Jon Hamm (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Million Dollar Arm, starring Jon Hamm (2014)20160226
This was a sweet and heart warming story. I was surprised at how
good it was, in particular I was moved by the scenes at the end of
the India trip. I'm glad the guy was redeemed.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: The Last Witch Hunter, starring Vin Diesel (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: The Last Witch Hunter, starring Vin Diesel (2015)20160226
This movie was way better than I expected it to be. The visuals
were really awesome and the plot was definitely intriguing. I
thought the romance was organic and cute without any lewd
angles. The twists in the movie were especially strong and metered
out well.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Pitch Perfect, starring Anna Kendrick (2002)
entry.content:
Movie: Pitch Perfect, starring Anna Kendrick (2002)20160226
This was a very cute movie with a pretty unique plot. There was way
too much talk about sex and things like that for my taste, but it
was pretty nice. I dislike how the end of the movie just drops off
and there's no culmination of the plot lines related to the radio
and the guy there.
  • Movies
  • 2002

entry.title: Movie: Extraction, starring Kellan Lutz (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Extraction, starring Kellan Lutz (2015)20160224
This was a pretty bad movie in a lot of ways. There were definitely
things that I liked, such as the Gina Carano and the beginning
moments. But so much of the rest of the movie was pretty bad. It
was pretty embarrassing the way that they referred to Gina's
character as all sexy when she was just a total brick. There was
also absolutely no chemistry between the two leads. It's sad
because Haywire was so awesome.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Book: The Last Days of Socrates, by Plato with Christopher Rowe (2010)
entry.content:
Book: The Last Days of Socrates, by Plato with Christopher Rowe (2010)20160220
I've been reading this for a while. I just finished Socrates'
defense. It's quite sad and defeatist.
  • Books
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: Run All Night, starring Liam Neeson (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Run All Night, starring Liam Neeson (2015)20160217
This was an intense movie. I liked the plot and how quickly things
went bad in a believable way. I enjoyed the moments with the family
and the plodding acknowledgment of everyone of what was going to
happen. I dislike that there was no resolution of the dirty cops.
  • Movies
  • 2015
